title: League ping is in the 300s. Nothing else lags except for League.
body:
EDIT: Nvm. This has been resolved for me. I am unsure if other people are affected though.

This started to happen around 25 minutes ago and it just costed me a Ranked game. Is it Rogers side acting up again because this has been happening quite frequently throughout the past 2 months.

replies.body: I have been noticing a fair amount of packet loss this morning, but I'm glad to hear you've fixed your issue! If you start getting crazy lag spikes again, please grab those network logs from that game and let this [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743) scan them. Post that image here in a reply and I'll be sure to look over them for you!

Not OP.

I'm out of a game where I experienced lag spikes as well. I disconnected/reconnected voluntarily after a death to see if it would help. I also closed all of the active application i had that might have been using my internet connection. As a side note, I'm alone and there's no other device connected to the internet right now. [Is this the picture you're asking for?](https://www.dropbox.com/s/v9gavc9qq53yx1v/packetLoss.png?dl=0)

As a note, I haven't had any packet loss since..... long enough for me to forget when was the last time I had packet loss

I'm gonna go ahead and have you hit up the [Connection Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664) first as you are dealing with an extreme amount of packet loss. It could be many things causing it, so I want to eliminate this being one of them. 


Then second thing I want you to do is Download [WinMTR](http://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/Latest/WinMTR-v092.zip/download)
Select the correct download then Run WinMTR. In the Host field, please enter in the one of the following address for the server you're currently playing on and click Start.

NA Server:
192.64.170.252
and
104.160.131.1

For each test, run it for five minutes and refrain from testing these in matchmaking games. Best to go to a custom game to test it and see if the issue has been resolved.

Thank you for the follow up, I really appreciate it.

[It appears most likely that the issue was ISP related](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/1VluGcrg-lag-spikes-in-rankeds?comment=0006).

[At the moment it seems that everything is fine](http://i.imgur.com/AwQq2tm.png) , and I'm no longer under any of the zones of the outage map.

However[ I will still provide you with the WinMTR logs](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/bijkpv770o764kk/AAAu7PUjxd9n81SLUpsB9AEYa?dl=0) in case you enjoy looking at packet loss reports in your free time. Dw, I don't judge, I love you for who you are.

In all fairness i'm filling in for the Porobros who can understand Packet Loss a bit better than I! I had my tech team buddy give me some analogy about a tomato truck driving to Riot? I get it now, but it's still something i'm learning about :) Thanks for those logs though.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E8AFF3g7,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-08-07T22:52:12.031+0000)
>
> I have been noticing a fair amount of packet loss this morning, but I'm glad to hear you've fixed your issue! If you start getting crazy lag spikes again, please grab those network logs from that game and let this [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743) scan them. Post that image here in a reply and I'll be sure to look over them for you!

It's happening again. So weird since it's going on and off. Here's an image of the little chart when I used your Log Reader page: https://i.gyazo.com/8c1f8b5f4428a8103d56876488d04ffe.png

Would appreciate if this is fixed ASAP because it usually comes in the middle of a game.

Dang, more packet loss =\ . Since this mostly originates outside of your network and before that connection ever reaches us, there's not much we'll be able to do. Reach out to your ISP to confirm that there aren't any ongoing issues, and if not hit up our techies in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with those network logs. They might be able to spot something they could tweak to help out!
Over on my reddit post (https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/6s9frb/current_client_lag_anyone/) All people reporting the issue have Bell as their internet service provider
Coming here to say I'm also having issues with my ping. 200-300 sometimes 500ms. This has not happened to me in 5 years.
